page.title: 18BUCTON CASTLE (CONT)
page.content: The remains of the camp now consist of a shaped rampart and ditch;the ditch was originally constructed to the north,east,and south east;the other edges being so precipitous as not to need one.The profile of the rampart can be clearly seen on the skyline of the valley to-day.From the camp,along the side of the{Noon Sun Hill}runs a road to Greenfield following the line of an earlier track.This was paved by the Romans,and many sections are still in existence to-day;the heavily rutted stone paving slabs are evidence of a heavy flow of wheeled traffic at that time.Other interconnecting early tracks were used to cross the valley to join a Roman road which ran along the summit of{Luzley Brows}and{Light {Birches.}This road connected {Castleshaw}camp more directly with {Mancunium,Melandra}and {Kaskenmoor.
